Article.Abstract: Both CD4(+) type 1 helper T (Th1) cells and CD8(+) cytotoxic T lymphocytes (CTL) play pivotal roles in protection against Mycobacterium tuberculosis infection. Here, we identified Th1 and CTL epitopes on a novel protective antigen, MPT51, in BALB/c and C57BL/6 mice. Mice were immunized with plasmid DNA encoding MPT51 by using a gene gun, and gamma interferon (IFN-gamma) production from the immune spleen cells was analyzed in response to a synthetic overlapping peptide library covering the mature MPT51 sequence. In BALB/c mice, only one peptide, p21-40, appeared to stimulate the immune splenocytes to produce IFN-gamma. Flow cytometric analysis with intracellular IFN-gamma and the T-cell phenotype revealed that the p21-40 peptide contains an immunodominant CD8(+) T-cell epitope. Further analysis with a computer-assisted algorithm permitted identification of a T-cell epitope, p24-32. In addition, a major histocompatibility complex class I stabilization assay with TAP2-deficient RMA-S cells transfected with K(d), D(d), or L(d) indicated that the epitope is presented by D(d). Finally, we proved that the p24-32/D(d) complex is recognized by IFN-gamma-producing CTL. In C57BL/6 mice, we observed H2-A(b)-restricted dominant and subdominant Th1 epitopes by using T-cell subset depletion analysis and three-color flow cytometry. The data obtained are useful for analyzing the role of MPT51-specific T cells in protective immunity and for designing a vaccine against M. tuberculosis infection.
Article.ArticleTitle: Identification of murine H2-Dd- and H2-Ab-restricted T-cell epitopes on a novel protective antigen, MPT51, of Mycobacterium tuberculosis.
Article.Affiliations: Department of Microbiology and Immunology, Hamamatsu University School of Medicine, 1-20-1 Handa-yama, Hamamatsu 431-3192, Japan.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Flow cytometric analyses were performed on peptide-restimulated splenocytes from DNA-vaccinated BALB/C mice. CD4+ T-cells did not produce IFN- but CD8+ T-cells did.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Flow cytometric analyses were performed on peptide-restimulated splenocytes from DNA-vaccinated C57BL/6 mice. CD8+ T-cells did not produce IFN- in response to p191, but CD4+ T-cells did. An ELISA assay demonstrated that depletion of CD4+ T-cells eliminated IFN- production, whereas depletion of CD8+ T-cells did not. These data indicate that p171 contains a Th1 epitope. p171 was demonstrated to be a dominant Th1 epitope when compared to p191 in C57BL/6 mice, which are H-2<sup>b</sup>.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: Flow cytometric analyses were performed on peptide-restimulated splenocytes from DNA-vaccinated C57BL/6 mice. CD8+ T-cells did not produce IFN- in response to p191, but CD4+ T-cells did, although at a lower level than for p171. An ELISA assay demonstrated that depletion of CD4+ T-cells eliminated IFN- production, whereas depletion of CD8+ T-cells did not. These data indicate that p191 contains a Th1 epitope. p191 was found to be a subdominant Th1 epitope when compared to p171 in C57BL/6 mice, which are H-2<sup>b</sup>.

Epitope.EpitopeComments: The data for p24-32 collectively indicate that this peptide is an H2-D<sup>d</sup>-restricted CD8+ T-cell epitope.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 4 doses of plasmid DNA-coated gold particles at one week intervals

AssayInformation.AssayComments: RMA-S D<sup>d</sup> cells were pulsed with peptide for 1 hour and then used to stimulate splenocytes from immunized mice for 24 hours before the supernatant was assayed by ELISA. p24-32 peptide-pulsed RMA-S- D<sup>d</sup> cells, but not RMA-S- K<sup>d</sup> or RMA-S- L<sup>d</sup> cells were able to stimulate immune spleen cells to produce IFN-.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 4 doses of plasmid DNA-coated gold particles at one week intervals

AssayInformation.AssayComments: CD8+T cells responded to the epitope by producing IFN-, but CD4+ T cells did not respond to peptide 24-32. Flow cytometric analyses were performed on peptide-restimulated splenocytes from mpt51-DNA-vaccinated mice. An Elispot for IFN- production was also positive.

FirstInVivoProcess.DoseSchedule: 4 doses of plasmid DNA-coated gold particles at one week intervals

Immunization.ImmunizationComments: Peptide-pulsed syngeneic spleen cells were treated with mitomycin and used to restimulate spleen cells from immunized BALB/c mice for 5 days.

AssayInformation.AssayComments: RMA-S target cells were pulsed with peptide for 1.5 hours prior to the cytotoxicity assay. P815 cells (H-2<sup>d</sup>) were also used as target cells and were substantially lysed by splenocytes from MPT51-DNA-immunized mice. These data indicate that the p24-32 peptide is an H2-D<sup>d</sup>-restricted CD8+ T cell epitope.

The abilities of peptides to bind to H2-K<sup>d</sup>, H2-D<sup>d</sup>, and H2-L<sup>d</sup> were measured by flow cytometry to determine the stabilization of MHC Class I molecules on the surfaces of RMA-S cell lines transfected with H2-K<sup>d</sup>, H2-D<sup>d</sup>, and H2-L<sup>d</sup> genes. Peptide 24-32 bound to H2-D<sup>d</sup>.
